questions.question_text:
Note: This question is part of a series of questions that present the same scenario. Each question in the series contains a unique solution that might meet the stated goals. Some question sets might have more than one correct solution, while others might not have a correct solution.
After you answer a question in this section, you will NOT be able to return to it. As a result, these questions will not appear in the review screen.
You are a Dynamics 365 Finance system administrator. You have a test environment that is used by several people at any given time.
You create a new data entity in your development environment and migrate the code to the test environment. In the test environment, you are unable to find the data entity in the list.
You need to locate the data entity.
Solution: Enable the Public API check box in the data entity.
Does the solution meet the goal?

discussion.content:
The answer is NO
Refresh Entity List using Data management workspace to view newly created/deployed entities in the data entity list.

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
A company implements Dynamics 365 Finance.
You set up a conference room pilot. You must configure the pilot with information from another instance by using the Data management tool.
//IMG//

Use the drop-down menus to select the answer choice that answers each question based on the information presented in the graphic.
NOTE: Each selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

discussion.content: I think the answer is correct. The question, however, is stated so to confuse you on purpose. There is no doubts about the first one, since it relates to import that must be done in correct order. The second, however, is worded to trick you, because it is not about importing the data, but rather exporting. If you look carefully at the image, the export is configured with incremental push, so this is why only the subset of data appears in your exported file, and as a result, only this subset is imported. So, for export job you need to configure it for full push.
The answer is correct. You have to set - full push then all customers will import to polit.
In the image it shows an export, yet the question says import...
I also think that both answers are the same.

I think for Q2 the answer is same as Q1, lets say that the customer groups import is partial and that some customer groups have not been imported, in that case customers with those customer groups will throw error and not get imported. I think this is what the question also says when it says a subset of customers do not get imported.

Q1. Agree
Q2. Is this correct? 
Isn't "Set default refresh .. full push only" for export of data and not import?

comments.content: I dont think the answer is correct for Q2. I dont see any answer by the way

discussion.content:
Shouldn't the first answer be: sales tax reporting codes?
It will start immediately, while the sales tax code values only start importing after the sales tax codes have been imported.

comments.content: Not agree. First starts execution unit 1, then 2 etc. Moreover (just one more argument vs wveynd version) if the logic is different we don't know anyway how many records in each entity. So the original answers are correct.

If they run in parallel wouldn't that mean all of them are running thus A is correct? The question assumes that a specific execution unit 1 item should run with 2,3,4 which does not make sense. It wouldn't normally matter which execution unit 1 item runs first (if I am wrong please explain clearly).

Execution units 1, 2, 3 and 4 will be imported in parallel and will start import immediately, answer "sales tax reporting codes" is correct.
From a Microsoft documentation:
For example, sales tax exempt numbers is set in its own Execution unit = 2. This data entity will start loading immediately because there are no dependencies on other entities loading before it.

discussion.content:
The answer should be C & C
Entities in different execution units are processed in parallel.
In each execution unit, entities are processed in parallel if they have the same level.
In each level, entities are processed according to their sequence number in that level.
After one level has been processed, the next level is processed.

comments.content: Execution units 1, 2, 3 and 4 will be imported in parallel

discussion.content: The provided answers are correct!
The answer should be C & C

"In order to successfully import sales tax codes and groups, the sales tax codes and details have to be loaded first, before sales tax groups can be imported. Sales tax codes and groups are all in Execution unit = 1, but the sequences are in the order that they will be imported. Other related sales tax entities that are not dependent upon other data entities being loaded are included in the package. For example, sales tax exempt numbers is set in its own Execution unit = 2. This data entity will start loading immediately because there are no dependencies on other entities loading before it."

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/data-entities/data-entities-data-packages
Both correct, see this link for explanation: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/data-entities/data-entities-data-packages

Agree
Q1: C
Q2: C
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/data-entities/data-entities-data-packages
for first = Sales Tax Reporting Code

comments.content: sorry, I mean C: Sales tax reporting codes

discussion.content:
D is correct in first question
- Entities in different execution units are processed in parallel.
- In each execution unit, entities are processed in parallel if they have the same level.
- In each level, entities are processed according to their sequence number in that level.
- After one level has been processed, the next level is processed.
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/data-entities/data-import-export-job

comments.content: D is not correct due we are talking about immediate execution in scope one data package. The entities with sequence greater 1 should wait until sequence 1 will be completed. And actually we have several data packages (execution units) in the task.

discussion.content: B, D is correct as of execution id and level

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
A company sets up a data package to import data by using the data management framework. You have the following data entity sequence.
//IMG//

Use the drop-down menus to select the answer choice that answers each question based on the information presented in the graphic.
NOTE: Each selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

You are a Dynamics 365 Finance system administrator.
Data is being migrated from a customized version of a legacy application to Dynamics 365 Finance. Some of the fields in the entity are the same, and some are different.
As a starting point, you need to automatically map as many fields as possible within Dynamics 365 Finance.
Which feature or tool should you use?

discussion.content: "Generate source mapping" is the right answer

comments.content: Mapping is always automatic. The visualization shows the automatically generated mapping which you can modify. You use the 'Generate Source Mapping' functionality only if you have changed the contents of the import file to re-generate a mapping.
The question says "Automatic", visualization mapping is manual.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. Generate source mapping. This is a correct answer because generating source mapping is a feature that allows you to automatically map the fields between the source and target data entities based on the field names and data types. This feature can save you time and effort when you migrate data from a legacy application to Dynamics 365 Finance. 
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/sysadmin/optimize-data-migration

Selected Answer: B
Answer B

Selected Answer: A
According to Microsoft’s documentation, the mapping visualization tool shows the automatically generated mapping which you can modify. Mapping is always automatic. You use the ‘Generate Source Mapping’ functionality only if you have changed the contents of the import file to re-generate a mapping.
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/data-entities/data-entities-data-packages
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customerengagement/on-premises/customize/map-entity-fields?view=op-9-1

Selected Answer: A
Generate source mapping is used to return the mapping to its original generation if incorrect, almost as a "return to default mapping". As the question states "As a starting point,...." I'm assuming that this is the first mapping which is done "automatically" on setup and is only visible through the Mapping visualization tool. As the question also reference fields which are different from the legacy application, these could not be mapped using the Generate source mapping tool and we have to use the mapping in the Mapping visualization tool to handle these too.
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/data-entities/data-entities-data-packages?toc=%2Ffin-and-ops%2Ftoc.json#regenerate-a-map
Mods, please change answer to B, as corrected by everyone in this discussion.
B. Generate source mapping
This question was in MB-500 for developer exam too. Answer is B

Selected Answer: B
Should be generate source mapping
The right answer is B, because in the question it's stated that some fields are the same some are different, and with the Generate source mapping you accomplish that.

I quote from the provided link:

"View mapping

To view how an entity is mapped, locate the tile for the entity in the project, and then click View map.

We provide mapping visualization view (default) and mapping details view. A red asterisk (*) identifies any required fields in an entity. These fields must be mapped in order to work with the entity. Other fields can be unmapped as required when working with the entity.

 To unmap a field, highlight the field in either column (Entity or Source), click Delete selection, and then click Save. After saving, close the form to return to the project.

The field mapping from source to staging can also be edited after import using the same process."

Thus A is incorrect as the visual mapping tool allow manual changes. Mapping occurs automatically
A is correct
Generate Source Mapping
sorry but the Mappibg visualisation tool let you change the mapping, so the given answer is correct

comments.content: The question says 'automatic mapping'. 'Generate source mapping' is automatic. 'Visual mapping tool' is manual.

you can customize the mapping before import the entity. 
In this way you can have a default customized mapping that allows you to have all field mapped automatically when import the entityi file itself

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/data-entities/data-entities-data-packages?toc=%2Ffin-and-ops%2Ftoc.json#mapping

discussion.content: I would said it's B no ? visualization has nothing automatic

choices.D: Use the Data task automation tool

discussion.content:
You can use the Microsoft Dynamics AX 2009 Data migration tool (DMT) to migrate your data from AX 2009 to Finance and Operations. Using the DMT is the only supported upgrade path from AX 2009. 

Same. My answer is C. 
Data Import Export Framework wasn't introduced until AX2012.

comments.content:
AX 2009 does not have DIXF which is after AX 2012
So Answer is DMT

discussion.content: In my opinion is C

Selected Answer: D
Dynamics AX 2009 Data migration tool (DMT). This is an incorrect answer because DMT is a tool that helps you migrate your data from Dynamics AX 2009 to Dynamics 365 Finance. It does not allow you to create a data package from a group of entities in Dynamics AX 2009.

Selected Answer: D
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/migration-upgrade/ax2009-upgrade-export-package

Selected Answer: C
The Data Import/Export Framework (DIXF) in Microsoft Dynamics AX 2009 can indeed be used to retrieve data that must be migrated to finance and operations1. However, the Data migration tool (DMT) is the only supported upgrade path from AX 2009 to finance and operations2.

The DMT is specifically designed to help you find and fill gaps between the table schemas for each version, as well as helping you move your data2. It provides a more comprehensive and tailored approach for migrating data from Dynamics AX 2009 to Dynamics 365 Finance2.

While DIXF creates a staging table for each entity in the Microsoft Dynamics AX database where the target table resides3, DMT goes a step further by allowing you to map the table fields between the source and target environments, apply conversions to the source data, set up default values for the source data, and apply query filters2. This makes DMT a more robust tool for this specific migration scenario.

Selected Answer: D
D. Data Import/Export Framework (DIXF)

The Data Import/Export Framework (DIXF) is a tool that allows you to export data from Dynamics AX 2009 and import it into Dynamics 365 Finance efficiently. It provides data entities and data packages to facilitate the data migration process. With DIXF, you can define the data entities you want to export, configure data packages, and perform data migration tasks effectively.

TAKEN FROM MICROSOFT OFFICIAL PRACTICE TEST ANSWER EXPLANATION.... 

DMT The Data Migration Tool - data migration - Dynamics AX 2009 and Finance and Operations apps. 

The Upgrade Analyzer - data migration between AX2012 R2/R3 and Finance and Operations apps. 

Dynamics AX 2009 Data packages are used in Dynamics 365 Finance. 

Lifecycle Services code upgrade tool - Data migration between Dynamics AX 2012 and finance and operations apps.

Selected Answer: C
The answer is C.

Selected Answer: C
I followed the link provided and it confirmed the answer was C not D.
The first line reads "You can use the Data Import/Export Framework (DIXF) service in Microsoft Dynamics AX 2009 to retrieve data" but if you read on it says "The export package that the Data migration tool (DMT) generates can consist of one or many data entities." Since the question says you "need to create a data package", the correct tool is DMT. DIXF generates the data for DMT to create a package.
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/migration-upgrade/ax2009-upgrade-export-package

Selected Answer: C
I think "C" is the correct answer...
Question is about getting the data OUT of AX2009 (export to data package) --> you use the DMT for that

Selected Answer: C
DIXF isn't available in AX 2009. So DMT needs to be used

comments.content: DMT uses DIXF as service and not tool itself. So answer should be C. Will still perform all the steps in DMT

discussion.content:
The correct answer is D as stated.

"You can use the Data Import/Export Framework (DIXF) service in Microsoft Dynamics AX 2009 to retrieve data that must be migrated to Finance and Operations."

As reference, please, see the process flow on this MS-site:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/migration-upgrade/data-migration-tool

"You can use the Data Import/Export Framework (DIXF) service in Microsoft Dynamics AX 2009 to retrieve data that must be migrated to Finance and Operations."

D is correct answer

C.

DMT generate the data package

C is good. Please note, that the question refers to creation of data package. Such action is performed by DMT.

Should be C - "The export package that the Data migration tool (DMT) generates ..." Here the question is to ask how to create data package. Option D DIXF is used to retrieve data.

D is correct. As indicated on microsoft web site. so clear. 
"You can use the Data Import/Export Framework (DIXF) service in Microsoft Dynamics AX 2009 to retrieve data that must be migrated to Finance and Operations."

questions.question_text:
You plan the migration from Dynamics AX 2009 to a Dynamics 365 Finance environment.
You will be moving data.
You need to create a data package from a group of entities in Dynamics AX 2009.
What should you use?
